page.title: 01FOCUS ON WEST WITTERING
page.content:
East Wittering School was given a second area to survey which is situated 9 miles South of Chichester, on the coastal plain of West Sussex. The 4km x 3km block consisted of three distinct and seperate physical features.
1) The Coastal Strip. 2) The Residential Area. 3) The Farmland.
1.{The Coastal Area}surveyed consisted of a sandy beach that faced South.The beach is safe for bathing and is very popular with both locals and holiday makers.At the Western seaward end of the block is East Head,a long sand bank which is now conserved by the National Trust as an area of specific natural interest.
